words.defineEn: to engage in a fight or argument
words.defineVi: tham gia vào một cuộc chiến hoặc tranh luận

words.defineEn: to show one's disagreement or disapproval of an online post or comment by clicking on a specific icon
words.defineVi: để thể hiện sự không đồng ý hoặc không tán thành một bài đăng hoặc nhận xét trực tuyến bằng cách nhấp vào một biểu tượng cụ thể

words.defineEn: the action of showing one's disagreement or disapproval of an online post or comment by clicking on a specific icon
words.defineVi: hành động thể hiện sự không đồng ý hoặc không tán thành của một người đối với một bài đăng hoặc nhận xét trực tuyến bằng cách nhấp vào một biểu tượng cụ thể

words.defineEn: to argue or fight until a disagreement is resolved
words.defineVi: để tranh luận hoặc chiến đấu cho đến khi một sự bất đồng được giải quyết

words.defineEn: a quarrel or fight
words.defineVi: một cuộc cãi vã hoặc chiến đấu

examples: When Prester John’s letter appeared, Europe was embroiled in the Crusades.
Soon, though, Japan was embroiled in World War Two and the country's auto industry shifted production to help with the war effort.
Instead, the U.S. became embroiled in low intensity conflicts in the Middle East.
At the time that Termen was working, Russia was embroiled in a Civil War.
If and when it reopens, it could be embroiled in mass protests.
words.defineEn: to involve someone in an argument, conflict, or complex situation
words.defineVi: liên quan đến ai đó trong một cuộc tranh cãi, xung đột hoặc tình huống phức tạp

examples: They exchanged views on every subject under the sun.
Our policy only allows for exchanges.
The couple knelt before the altar to exchange their vows.
The thug threw dust in her eyes and exchanged her real diamonds with fake stones.
The conference is a good place to share information and exchange ideas.
words.defineEn: a brief conversation, often between two people who are in disagreement about something
words.defineVi: một cuộc trò chuyện ngắn, thường là giữa hai người đang bất đồng về một cái gì đó

examples: Excuse me, I lost my train of thoughts.
Excuse me, but there’s a phone call for you.
Excuse me, is this the way to the station?
Excuse me, you're wanted on the phone.
Excuse me, but I don't think that's true.
words.defineEn: said before one disagrees with someone in order to not be rude or offensive
words.defineVi: nói trước khi một người không đồng ý với ai đó để không thô lỗ hoặc xúc phạm

words.defineEn: to strongly argue, disapprove, or disagree with someone or something
words.defineVi: để tranh luận mạnh mẽ, không chấp thuận, hoặc không đồng ý với một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

words.defineEn: the action of strongly arguing, disapproving, or disagreeing with someone or something; a statement in which a person strongly argues, disapproves, or disagrees with something or someone
words.defineVi: hành động tranh luận gay gắt, không tán thành hoặc không đồng ý với ai đó hoặc điều gì đó; một tuyên bố trong đó một người tranh luận mạnh mẽ, không tán thành hoặc không đồng ý với một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó

examples: Let's have a face-off of the most burly olympic hurling events - the Hammer throw, Javelin, Discus, and Shot Put.
words.defineEn: an argument or fight between people
words.defineVi: một cuộc tranh luận hoặc chiến đấu giữa mọi người

words.defineEn: to fight, argue, etc. with someone or to get ready for doing so
words.defineVi: để chiến đấu, tranh luận, vv với ai đó hoặc sẵn sàng để làm như vậy

examples: The empire is riddled with factions, all with an eye on the main chance
There are factions.
Rogue factions could use molecular manufacturing to stockpile weapons.
It’s the Wall Street faction.
It’s the Wall Street faction.
words.defineEn: arguments and disagreements between small groups of people within a political party or an organization
words.defineVi: tranh luận và bất đồng giữa các nhóm nhỏ người trong một đảng chính trị hoặc một tổ chức

examples: Sarah had a stable job that provided her with financial security, but when she had a falling out with her bread and butter, her boss, she was let go and had to search for a new source of income.
Maria had been part of a social group, but when she had a falling out with one of the members, they quickly excluded her and moved on, proving that a bellowing cow soon forgets her calf.

It's been years since we had that falling out, and even though we're on good terms now, I still feel like something is missing - I suppose it's true what they say, a broken friendship may be soldered but will never be sound.
The hair started falling out.
And I can sit in my chair without falling out.
words.defineEn: a situation in which people are no longer friendly with each other as a result of a disagreement or quarrel
words.defineVi: một tình huống trong đó mọi người không còn thân thiện với nhau do bất đồng hoặc cãi vã

examples: Tom was a talented musician, but when he fell out with his bread and butter, his bandmates, they kicked him out of the band, causing him to lose his primary source of income from performing gigs.
The window fell out.
And then, the bottom fell out.
Oh, and your teeth fall out.
So, "Your teeth fall out as you get older."
words.defineEn: to be no longer friendly with someone as a result of an argument
words.defineVi: không còn thân thiện với ai đó do tranh cãi

words.word: far be it from me to
words.phonetic: fɑːɹ biː ɪt fɹʌm miː tuː
words.defineEn: used to make it clear that one is about to criticize or disagree with someone but is unwilling to do so
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để làm rõ rằng một người sắp chỉ trích hoặc không đồng ý với ai đó nhưng không muốn làm như vậy

examples: We have closed the book on this feud.
God, I love historian feuds.
Babe, nobody reads when the family feuds.
By the end of 2015, the feud had made it to the world stage.
They got into a bloody feud with the infamous street gang MS-13.
words.defineEn: a heated argument that lasts for a long time
words.defineVi: một cuộc tranh luận sôi nổi kéo dài trong một thời gian dài

examples: We have closed the book on this feud.
God, I love historian feuds.
Babe, nobody reads when the family feuds.
By the end of 2015, the feud had made it to the world stage.
They got into a bloody feud with the infamous street gang MS-13.
words.defineEn: to have a prolonged and heated argument with someone
words.defineVi: để có một cuộc tranh luận kéo dài và nóng với ai đó

words.defineEn: sharp disagreements between people that last for a long time
words.defineVi: những bất đồng gay gắt giữa những người kéo dài trong một thời gian dài

examples: He rarely fought his political battles in the open.
Fighting like cats and dogs like always.
The children had pillow fights during their sleepover.
He has always fought the good fight against oppression.
A young cyclist is fighting for his life after the accident.
words.defineEn: an argument over something
words.defineVi: một cuộc tranh luận về một cái gì đó

examples: He rarely fought his political battles in the open.
Fighting like cats and dogs like always.
The children had pillow fights during their sleepover.
He has always fought the good fight against oppression.
A young cyclist is fighting for his life after the accident.
words.defineEn: to take part in a violent action, either physical or verbal, against someone
words.defineVi: tham gia vào một hành động bạo lực, thể chất hoặc lời nói, chống lại ai đó

words.defineEn: to use methods or tactics similar to those of one's opponent in a fight or argument
words.defineVi: sử dụng các phương pháp hoặc chiến thuật tương tự như của đối thủ trong một cuộc chiến hoặc tranh luận

examples: Thousands of people have been driven from their homes by the fighting.
This time, I will go down fighting if I have to.
The game turned ugly in the final minutes, when two players were ejected for fighting.
One of our great strengths is our ability to take it on the chin and come out fighting.
Whenever our parents' fighting got up to eleven, my sister and I made ourselves scarce.
words.defineEn: involvement in a physical struggle against another person or group
words.defineVi: tham gia vào một cuộc đấu tranh thể chất chống lại người khác hoặc nhóm

words.defineEn: to fight until a result is achieved or an agreement is reached
words.defineVi: để chiến đấu cho đến khi đạt được một kết quả hoặc đạt được một thỏa thuận

words.phonetic: tə faɪt wʌn bækslæʃ ɛs oʊn bæɾəlz
words.defineEn: to fight for what one wants or win an argument without the help of someone else
words.defineVi: để đấu tranh cho những gì một người muốn hoặc giành chiến thắng trong một cuộc tranh luận mà không cần sự giúp đỡ của người khác

examples: Boom, first flap down.
This flap is pretty big.
And see that funny flap?
Shawn, also three now, flaps his hands in front of his face.
Isis flapped her wings over the body and Osiris revived.
words.defineEn: much public anger or discussion
words.defineVi: nhiều sự tức giận hoặc thảo luận công khai

examples: So the fracas spilled out from Sal's pizzeria to the street.
And there was a fracas, in which Captain Cook was killed by at least one Hawaiian.

And I see Corrections on that where you crossed out so I will go on to the Washington Post article that was Originally published on September 16th of this year and should I just not look at this fracas here.
words.defineEn: a noisy fight or argument, which usually a lot of people take part in
words.defineVi: một cuộc chiến hoặc tranh luận ồn ào, thường có rất nhiều người tham gia

examples: Support for the leader was fraying at the edges.
Our roommate relationship is starting to fray around the edges now that Pat has begun leaving his stuff, including dirty dishes, all over the apartment.
The chromosomes fray out back into chromatin.
A new robot is entering the fray.
Their industrial cables frayed during turbulent weather and snapped under the weight of their decks.
words.defineEn: an intense argument, fight, or contest
words.defineVi: một cuộc tranh luận gay gắt, chiến đấu, hoặc cuộc thi

examples: Otherwise, there will be a free-for-all.
So that pretty little garden or that freshly mowed lawn, that is a free-for-all for groundhogs.
Since I started feeling bad, it’s kind of been a free-for-all in here.
I’m expecting the debates to be a free-for-all.
words.defineEn: a loud argument or fight that many people take part in
words.defineVi: một cuộc tranh luận lớn hoặc chiến đấu mà nhiều người tham gia

examples: Talk about a frenemy.
And then I have my nemesis, my enemy, my frenemy.
Up next we got Frenemy.
But the contributions of Darwin’s lesser-known frenemy Wallace still deserve to be remembered.
When we look for habitable worlds orbiting other stars, it might be useful not just to look for Earth-like planets, but also to see what a Jupiter-like frenemy might be up to nearby.
words.defineEn: a person who pretends to be a friend when in reality is one's rival or enemy
words.defineVi: một người giả vờ là bạn trong khi thực tế là đối thủ hoặc kẻ thù của một người

examples: Friction exerts a force in the direction opposite of the motion.
An example of a non-conservative force is friction.
Friction is super important.
So friction comes from something.
So what is friction really?
words.defineEn: absence of agreement or friendliness between people with different opinions
words.defineVi: không có thỏa thuận hoặc thân thiện giữa những người có ý kiến khác nhau

examples: This collection of stories bridges the gap between history and fiction.
She had a gap between her front teeth that added character to her smile.
They have a significant age gap but are happily married.
He tried to push his hand through the gap but it wouldn't go.
Richard Atlas bridged a gap between public and private funders by establishing the L.A. Partnership for Early Childhood Investment.
words.defineEn: a difference, particularly an unwanted one, causing separation between two people, situations, or opinions
words.defineVi: một sự khác biệt, đặc biệt là một điều không mong muốn, gây ra sự tách biệt giữa hai người, tình huống hoặc ý kiến

examples: But, when a gust of wind comes at the wrong time, it will cause the pilot to execute a go-around instead of landing.
words.defineEn: an argument or disagreement
words.defineVi: một cuộc tranh luận hoặc bất đồng

words.phonetic: tə ɡoʊ slæʃ biː æɾ ɪt hæmɚ ænd tɑːŋz
words.defineEn: to engage in an activity, particularly an argument, in a forceful, energetic, or violent manner
words.defineVi: tham gia vào một hoạt động, đặc biệt là một cuộc tranh luận, một cách mạnh mẽ, tràn đầy năng lượng hoặc bạo lực

words.defineEn: to support someone or something in an argument with another person
words.defineVi: để hỗ trợ một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó trong một cuộc tranh luận với người khác

examples: We use the word gridlock over and over again.
Well, we probably have gridlock, but I hope not.
We must choose between greatness or gridlock, results or resistance, vision or vengeance, incredible progress or pointless destruction.
There was an impasse, a gridlock in society about what the way forward was.
They want to end partisan gridlock.
words.defineEn: (usually in politics) a situation in which no progress can be made because the people involved are unable to agree with one another
words.defineVi: (thường là trong chính trị) một tình huống không thể đạt được tiến bộ vì những người liên quan không thể đồng ý với nhau

examples: I haggled.
I want to buy something, I haggle with you.
You're terrible at haggling.
I don't know, I'm haggling with you.
Benny, you understand the art of haggling, what's the first thing I need to know?
words.defineEn: to argue in order to reach an agreement, particularly over the price of something
words.defineVi: để tranh luận để đạt được một thỏa thuận, đặc biệt là về giá của một cái gì đó

examples: Accidents like this happen all the time.
The most recent incident happened only a week ago.
The same thing happened to me.
Change doesn't happen overnight.
The door happened to be unlocked.
words.defineEn: used to state that one disagrees with someone or is annoyed by what they have said
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nói rằng một người không đồng ý với ai đó hoặc khó chịu bởi những gì họ đã nói

words.defineEn: ‌to express disapproval of something by making a noise in the throat
words.defineVi: ‌bày tỏ sự không tán thành điều gì đó bằng cách phát ra âm thanh trong cổ họng

examples: It was easy, without hassle.
It's too much hassle to deal with us as individuals.
It's just too much hassle factor of trying to balance between employees and employers.
If you've got your own plane or your corporate plane, you don't have to go through the security hassle.
Sure, it's a hassle to wait, but that's not the only problem.
words.defineEn: a dispute or disagreement between people
words.defineVi: một tranh chấp hoặc bất đồng giữa mọi người

examples: That hot guy had a good head on his shoulders.
The hotel had expensive rates during the holiday season.
The group has a new CD in the pipeline.
The police had the situation well in hand.
The theatre company has several new productions in the pipeline for next season.
words.defineEn: to make someone be at a position of disadvantage in an argument
words.defineVi: để làm cho ai đó ở vị trí bất lợi trong một cuộc tranh luận

words.phonetic: tə hæv ɐ pɹɑːbləm wɪð ɛsbiː slæʃ ɛstiːeɪtʃ
words.defineEn: to not to be able to approve or accept someone or something
words.defineVi: để không thể phê duyệt hoặc chấp nhận một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

words.defineEn: to argue with someone
words.defineVi: để tranh luận với ai đó

words.phonetic: tə hæv ɪɾ aʊt wɪð ɛsbiː
words.defineEn: to talk to someone frankly in order to settle a dispute or argument
words.defineVi: nói chuyện thẳng thắn với ai đó để giải quyết tranh chấp hoặc tranh luận

words.defineEn: used to angrily state that despite one's disagreement with what someone has said, one will not argue about it
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để tuyên bố một cách giận dữ rằng mặc dù không đồng ý với những gì ai đó đã nói, một người sẽ không tranh luận về điều đó

examples: Eggs are a great source of protein.
The chicken laid an egg in the nesting box.
The eggs cook quickly in a hot frying pan.
I wanted bacon and eggs for breakfast.
The brunch special featured a beefburger with a sunny-side-up egg, crispy bacon, and a dollop of hollandaise sauce.
words.defineEn: to throw eggs at a person or thing, often to express contempt
words.defineVi: ném trứng vào người hoặc vật, thường để bày tỏ sự khinh miệt
